Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Beto O'Rourke is asking for help in getting undocumented immigrants to vote, when in fact it was an impostor who sent the text message, not O'Rourke or his team.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Sean Hannity's statement about the text message accurately reflects O'Rourke's position, when in fact O'Rourke's campaign denied any involvement.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that O'Rourke is asking for help in getting undocumented immigrants to vote, as the text message was sent by an impostor and not by O'Rourke or his team.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that O'Rourke's campaign denied any involvement in the text message.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not mentioning that the text message was sent by an impostor and not by O'Rourke or his team.
Alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the text message was not sent by O'Rourke or his team, but by an impostor.
